title: Peer and Self-Assessment Strategies to Strengthen Fairness in Group Work Evaluation

context.prior_knowledge: Fundamental mathematical knowledge and group project experience
context.additional_context: Project-based assessment conducted in a limited-technology environment (primarily smartphones).

learning_goals: Students can propose at least three peer assessment criteria that specifically measure peers' contributions during group work.
Learners can accurately analyze their task contributions and areas for improvement by over 80% through self-evaluation reports at each project stage.
Participants can fairly allocate over 20% of the final individual score by synthesizing peer and self-assessment results.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
